00075 /*
00076  * This file, along with the corresponding header file (zesto-bpred.h), the
00077  * predictor definitions (in the ZCOMPS-bpred subdirectory), the fusion or
00078  * meta-prediction algorithms (in the ZCOMPS-fusion subdirectory), and the
00079  * target predictor definitions (in the ZCOMPS-btb and ZCOMPS-ras
00080  * subdirectories), provide a much more flexible and extensible interface to
00081  * the branch direction and branch target prediction mechanisms.
00082  *
00083  * All of the code for each branch prediction algorithm (or meta- predictor, or
00084  * target predictor, ...) is placed in its own, separate .cpp file in the
00085  * corresponding ZCOMPS-* subdirectory.  Adding new predictors is relatively
00086  * quick and painless.  The perl script make_def_lists.pl makes sure that all
00087  * of the code is included during compilation (the script is called from the
00088  * Makefile, so don't worry about it).
00089  */
00090 
00091 #include <math.h>
00092 #include "sim.h"
00093 #include "stats.h"
00094 #include "valcheck.h"
00095 #include "zesto-core.h"
00096 #include "zesto-bpred.h"
00097 
00098 #define BPRED_STAT(x) if(!frozen) {x}
00099 
00100 /*======================================================================*/
00101 /* The definitions are all placed in separate files, for organizational
00102    purposes.                                                            */
00103 /*======================================================================*/
00104 
00105 /* COMPONENT BRANCH DIRECTION PREDICTORS
00106 Arguments:
00107 sc       - pointer to a state container/cache for the predictor
00108 PC       - program counter (PC) value
00109 tPC      - taken-branch target address
00110 oPC      - "Oracle" PC or actual next instruction address, also shifted
00111 outcome  - actual (oracle) branch direction
00112 our_pred - what the branch predictor had predicted (some predictors
00113            need to know which way they predicted because update
00114            rules may vary depending on the correctness of the
00115            overall prediction).
00116  */
00117 #define BPRED_LOOKUP_HEADER \
00118   bool lookup(class bpred_sc_t * const scvp, const md_addr_t PC, const md_addr_t tPC, const md_addr_t oPC, const bool outcome)
00119 #define BPRED_UPDATE_HEADER \
00120   void update(class bpred_sc_t * const scvp, const md_addr_t PC, const md_addr_t tPC, const md_addr_t oPC, const bool outcome, const bool our_pred)
00121 #define BPRED_SPEC_UPDATE_HEADER \
00122   void spec_update(class bpred_sc_t * const scvp, const md_addr_t PC, const md_addr_t tPC, const md_addr_t oPC, const bool outcome, const bool our_pred)
00123 #define BPRED_RECOVER_HEADER \
00124   void recover(class bpred_sc_t * const scvp, const bool outcome)
00125 #define BPRED_FLUSH_HEADER \
00126   void flush(class bpred_sc_t * const scvp)
00127 #define BPRED_REG_STATS_HEADER \
00128   void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb, struct core_t * const core)
00129 #define BPRED_RESET_STATS_HEADER \
00130   void reset_stats(void)
00131 #define BPRED_GET_CACHE_HEADER \
00132   class bpred_sc_t * get_cache(void)
00133 #define BPRED_RET_CACHE_HEADER \
00134   void ret_cache(class bpred_sc_t * const scvp)
00135 
00136 #include "ZCOMPS-bpred.list"
00137 
00138 #define BPRED_PARSE_ARGS
00139 /*====================================================*/
00140 /* argument parsing                                   */
00141 /*====================================================*/
00142 static class bpred_dir_t *
00143 bpred_from_string(char * const opt_string)
00144 {
00145   char name[256];
00146   char type[256];
00147 
00148   /* the format string "%[^:]" for scanf reads a string consisting of non-':' characters */
00149   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%[^:]",type) != 1)
00150     fatal("malformed bpred option string: %s",opt_string);
00151 
00152   /* include the argument parsing code.  BPRED_PARSE_ARGS is defined to
00153      include only the parsing code and not the other branch predictor code. */
00154 #include "ZCOMPS-bpred.list"
00155 
00156   /* UNKNOWN Predictor Type */
00157   fatal("Unknown branch predictor type (%s)",opt_string);
00158 }
00159 #undef BPRED_PARSE_ARGS

00161 bpred_dir_t::bpred_dir_t(void)
00162 {
00163 }
00164 
00165 bpred_dir_t::~bpred_dir_t()
00166 {
00167   if(name) free(name); name = NULL;
00168   if(type) free(type); type = NULL;
00169 }
00170 
00171 void bpred_dir_t::init(void)
00172 {
00173   name = NULL;
00174   type = NULL;
00175   num_hits = 0;
00176   lookups = 0;
00177   updates = 0;
00178   spec_updates = 0;
00179   frozen = 0;
00180 }
00181 
00182 void bpred_dir_t::update(
00183     class bpred_sc_t * const sc,
00184     const md_addr_t PC,
00185     const md_addr_t tPC,
00186     const md_addr_t oPC,
00187     const bool outcome,
00188     const bool our_pred)
00189 {
00190   if(!sc->updated)
00191   {
00192     BPRED_STAT(updates++;)
00193     BPRED_STAT(num_hits += our_pred == outcome;)
00194     sc->updated = true;
00195   }
00196 }
00197 
00198 void bpred_dir_t::spec_update(
00199     class bpred_sc_t * const sc,
00200     const md_addr_t PC,
00201     const md_addr_t tPC,
00202     const md_addr_t oPC,
00203     const bool outcome,
00204     const bool our_pred)
00205 {
00206   BPRED_STAT(spec_updates++;)
00207 }
00208 
00209 void bpred_dir_t::recover(
00210     class bpred_sc_t * const sc,
00211     const bool outcome)
00212 {
00213   return;
00214 }
00215 
00216 void bpred_dir_t::flush(class bpred_sc_t * const sc)
00217 {
00218   return;
00219 }
00220 
00221 void bpred_dir_t::reg_stats(
00222     struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb,
00223     struct core_t * const core)
00224 {
00225   int id = 0;
00226   if(core)
00227     id = core->current_thread->id;
00228   char buf[256];
00229   char buf2[256];
00230   char buf3[256];
00231 
00232   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.type",id,name);
00233   sprintf(buf2,"prediction algorithm of %s",name);
00234   stat_reg_string(sdb, buf, buf2, type, NULL);
00235   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.bits",id,name);
00236   sprintf(buf2,"total size of %s in bits",name);
00237   stat_reg_int(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &bits, bits, NULL);
00238   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.size",id,name);
00239   sprintf(buf2,"total size of %s in KB",name);
00240   sprintf(buf3,"c%d.%s.bits/8192.0",id,name);
00241   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00242 
00243   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.lookups",id,name);
00244   sprintf(buf2,"number of prediction lookups in %s (including wrong-path)",name);
00245   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &lookups, lookups, NULL);
00246   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.updates",id,name);
00247   sprintf(buf2,"number of prediction updates in %s",name);
00248   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &updates, updates, NULL);
00249   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.spec_updates",id,name);
00250   sprintf(buf2,"number of speculative prediction updates in %s",name);
00251   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &spec_updates, spec_updates, NULL);
00252   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.hits",id,name);
00253   sprintf(buf2,"number of correct predictions in %s",name);
00254   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_hits, num_hits, NULL);
00255   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.hit_rate",id,name);
00256   sprintf(buf2,"fraction of correct predictions in %s",name);
00257   sprintf(buf3,"c%d.%s.hits/c%d.%s.updates",id,name,id,name);
00258   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00259   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.MPKI",id,name);
00260   sprintf(buf2,"misses per thousand insts in %s",name);
00261   sprintf(buf3,"((c%d.%s.updates - c%d.%s.hits) / c%d.commit_insn) * 1000.0",id,name,id,name,id);
00262   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00263 }
00264 
00265 void bpred_dir_t::reset_stats(void)
00266 {
00267   num_hits = 0;
00268   lookups = 0;
00269   updates = 0;
00270   spec_updates = 0;
00271 }
00272 
00273 class bpred_sc_t * bpred_dir_t::get_cache(void)
00274 {
00275   class bpred_sc_t * sc = new bpred_sc_t();
00276   if(!sc)
00277     fatal("couldn't calloc default State Cache");
00278   return sc;
00279 }

00281 void bpred_dir_t::ret_cache(class bpred_sc_t * const sc)
00282 {
00283   delete(sc);
00284 }
00285 
00286 /* FUSION/META-PREDICTION
00287 Arguments:
00288 scvp     - pointer to a state container/cache for the meta-predictor
00289 preds    - the individual predictions of the component predictors
00290 PC       - program counter (PC) value
00291 tPC      - taken-branch target address
00292 oPC      - "Oracle" PC or actual next instruction address
00293 outcome  - actual (oracle) branch direction
00294 our_pred - what the meta-predictor had predicted
00295  */
00296 #define FUSION_LOOKUP_HEADER \
00297   bool lookup(class fusion_sc_t * const scvp,const bool * const preds,const md_addr_t PC,const md_addr_t tPC,const md_addr_t oPC,const bool outcome)
00298 #define FUSION_UPDATE_HEADER \
00299   void update(class fusion_sc_t * const scvp,const bool * const preds,const md_addr_t PC,const md_addr_t tPC,const md_addr_t oPC,const bool outcome,const bool our_pred)
00300 #define FUSION_SPEC_UPDATE_HEADER \
00301   void spec_update(class fusion_sc_t * const scvp,const bool * const preds,const md_addr_t PC,const md_addr_t tPC,const md_addr_t oPC,const bool outcome,const bool our_pred)
00302 #define FUSION_RECOVER_HEADER \
00303   void recover(class fusion_sc_t * const scvp,bool const outcome)
00304 #define FUSION_FLUSH_HEADER \
00305   void flush(class fusion_sc_t * const scvp)
00306 #define FUSION_REG_STATS_HEADER \
00307   void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb, struct core_t * const core)
00308 #define FUSION_RESET_STATS_HEADER \
00309   void reset_stats(void)
00310 #define FUSION_GET_CACHE_HEADER \
00311   class fusion_sc_t * get_cache(void)
00312 #define FUSION_RET_CACHE_HEADER \
00313   void ret_cache(class fusion_sc_t * const scvp)
00314 
00315 #include "ZCOMPS-fusion.list"
00316 
00317 #define BPRED_PARSE_ARGS
00318 /*====================================================*/
00319 /* fusion argument parsing                            */
00320 /*====================================================*/
00321 static class fusion_t *
00322 fusion_from_string(
00323     const int num_pred,
00324     struct bpred_dir_t ** bpreds,
00325     char * const opt_string)
00326 {
00327   char name[256];
00328   char type[256];
00329 
00330   /* the format string "%[^:]" for scanf reads a string consisting of non-':' characters */
00331   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%[^:]",type) != 1)
00332     fatal("malformed fusion option string: %s",opt_string);
00333 
00334   /* include the argument parsing code.  BPRED_PARSE_ARGS is defined to
00335      include only the parsing code and not the other predictor code. */
00336 #include "ZCOMPS-fusion.list"
00337 
00338   /* UNKNOWN fusion Type */
00339   fatal("Unknown predictor fusion type (%s)",opt_string);
00340 }
00341 #undef BPRED_PARSE_ARGS

00353 void fusion_t::init(void)
00354 {
00355   name = NULL;
00356   type = NULL;
00357   num_hits = 0;
00358   lookups = 0;
00359   updates = 0;
00360   spec_updates = 0;
00361   frozen = false;
00362 }
00363 
00364 void fusion_t::update(
00365     class fusion_sc_t * const sc,
00366     const bool * const preds,
00367     const md_addr_t PC,
00368     const md_addr_t tPC,
00369     const md_addr_t oPC,
00370     const bool outcome,
00371     const bool our_pred)
00372 {
00373   if(!sc->updated)
00374   {
00375     BPRED_STAT(updates++;)
00376     BPRED_STAT(num_hits += our_pred == outcome;)
00377     sc->updated = true;
00378   }
00379 }
00380 
00381 void fusion_t::spec_update(
00382     class fusion_sc_t * const sc,
00383     const bool * const preds,
00384     const md_addr_t PC,
00385     const md_addr_t tPC,
00386     const md_addr_t oPC,
00387     const bool outcome,
00388     const bool our_pred)
00389 {
00390   /* default fusion struct is the same as the default bpred struct */
00391   BPRED_STAT(spec_updates++;)
00392   return;
00393 }

00407 void fusion_t::reg_stats(
00408     struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb,
00409     struct core_t * const core)
00410 {
00411   int id = 0;
00412   if(core)
00413     id = core->current_thread->id;
00414   char buf[256];
00415   char buf2[256];
00416   char buf3[256];
00417 
00418   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.type",id,name);
00419   sprintf(buf2,"fusion algorithm of %s",name);
00420   stat_reg_string(sdb, buf, buf2, type, NULL);
00421   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.bits",id,name);
00422   sprintf(buf2,"total size of %s in bits",name);
00423   stat_reg_int(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &bits, bits, NULL);
00424   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.size",id,name);
00425   sprintf(buf2,"total size of %s in KB",name);
00426   sprintf(buf3,"c%d.%s.bits/8192.0",id,name);
00427   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00428 
00429   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.lookups",id,name);
00430   sprintf(buf2,"number of prediction lookups in %s (including wrong-path)",name);
00431   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &lookups, lookups, NULL);
00432   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.updates",id,name);
00433   sprintf(buf2,"number of prediction updates in %s",name);
00434   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &updates, updates, NULL);
00435   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.spec_updates",id,name);
00436   sprintf(buf2,"number of speculative prediction updates in %s",name);
00437   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &spec_updates, spec_updates, NULL);
00438   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.hits",id,name);
00439   sprintf(buf2,"number of correct predictions in %s",name);
00440   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_hits, num_hits, NULL);
00441   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.hit_rate",id,name);
00442   sprintf(buf2,"fraction of correct predictions in %s",name);
00443   sprintf(buf3,"c%d.%s.hits/c%d.%s.updates",id,name,id,name);
00444   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00445   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.MPKI",id,name);
00446   sprintf(buf2,"misses per thousand insts in %s",name);
00447   sprintf(buf3,"((c%d.%s.updates - c%d.%s.hits) / c%d.commit_insn) * 1000.0",id,name,id,name,id);
00448   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00449 }

00471 
00472 /* BRANCH TARGET PREDICTION (not including subroutine returns)
00473 Arguments:
00474 scvp       - pointer to a state container/cache for the predictor
00475 PC         - program counter (PC) value, *not* shifted
00476 tPC        - taken-branch target address, *not* shifted
00477 oPC        - oracle PC or actual next instruction address, *not* shifted
00478 our_target - what the predictor said the next inst address would be
00479 outcome    - actual (oracle) branch direction
00480 our_pred   - what the branch-predictor had predicted
00481  */
00482 #define BTB_LOOKUP_HEADER \
00483   md_addr_t lookup(class BTB_sc_t * const scvp,const md_addr_t PC,const md_addr_t tPC,const md_addr_t oPC,const bool outcome,const bool our_pred)
00484 #define BTB_UPDATE_HEADER \
00485   void update(class BTB_sc_t * const scvp,const md_addr_t PC,const md_addr_t tPC,const md_addr_t oPC,const md_addr_t our_target,const bool outcome,const bool our_pred)
00486 #define BTB_SPEC_UPDATE_HEADER \
00487   void spec_update(class BTB_sc_t * const scvp,const md_addr_t PC,const md_addr_t tPC,const md_addr_t oPC,const md_addr_t our_target,const bool outcome,const bool our_pred)
00488 #define BTB_RECOVER_HEADER \
00489   void recover(class BTB_sc_t * const scvp,const bool outcome)
00490 #define BTB_FLUSH_HEADER \
00491   void flush(class BTB_sc_t * const scvp)
00492 #define BTB_REG_STATS_HEADER \
00493   void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb, struct core_t * const core)
00494 #define BTB_RESET_STATS_HEADER \
00495   void reset_stats(void)
00496 #define BTB_GET_CACHE_HEADER \
00497   class BTB_sc_t * get_cache(void)
00498 #define BTB_RET_CACHE_HEADER \
00499   void ret_cache(class BTB_sc_t * const scvp)
00500

00502 #include "ZCOMPS-btb.list"

00504 /*=================================================*/
00505 /* BTB argument parsing                            */
00506 /*=================================================*/
00507 #define BPRED_PARSE_ARGS
00508 static class BTB_t *
00509 BTB_from_string(char * const opt_string)
00510 {
00511   char name[256];
00512   char type[256];
00513 
00514   /* the format string "%[^:]" for scanf reads a string consisting of non-':' characters */
00515   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%[^:]",type) != 1)
00516     fatal("malformed BTB option string: %s",opt_string);
00517 
00518   /* include the argument parsing code.  BPRED_PARSE_ARGS is defined to
00519      include only the parsing code and not the other predictor code. */
00520 #include "ZCOMPS-btb.list"
00521 
00522   /* UNKNOWN BTB Type */
00523   fatal("Unknown BTB type (%s)",opt_string);
00524 }
00525 #undef BPRED_PARSE_ARGS

00538 void BTB_t::init(void)
00539 {
00540   name = NULL;
00541   type = NULL;
00542   num_hits = 0;
00543   lookups = 0;
00544   updates = 0;
00545   spec_updates = 0;
00546   num_nt = 0;
00547   bits = 0;

00550 
00551 void
00552 BTB_t::spec_update(
00553     class BTB_sc_t * const sc,
00554     const md_addr_t PC,
00555     const md_addr_t targetPC,
00556     const md_addr_t oraclePC,
00557     const md_addr_t our_target,
00558     const bool outcome,
00559     const bool our_pred)
00560 {
00561   BPRED_STAT(spec_updates++;)
00562   return;
00563 }
00564 
00565 void
00566 BTB_t::recover(
00567     class BTB_sc_t * const sc,
00568     const bool outcome)
00569 {
00570   return;
00571 }
00572 
00573 void BTB_t::flush(class BTB_sc_t * const sc)
00574 {
00575   return;
00576 }
00577 
00578 void
00579 BTB_t::reg_stats(
00580     struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb,
00581     struct core_t * const core)
00582 {
00583   int id = 0;
00584   if(core)
00585     id = core->current_thread->id;
00586   char buf[256];
00587   char buf2[256];
00588   char buf3[256];
00589 
00590   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.type",id,name);
00591   sprintf(buf2,"BTB type of %s",name);
00592   stat_reg_string(sdb, buf, buf2, type, NULL);
00593   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.bits",id,name);
00594   sprintf(buf2,"total size of %s in bits",name);
00595   stat_reg_int(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &bits, bits, NULL);
00596   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.size",id,name);
00597   sprintf(buf2,"total size of %s in KB",name);
00598   sprintf(buf3,"c%d.%s.bits/8192.0",id,name);
00599   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00600 
00601   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.lookups",id,name);
00602   sprintf(buf2,"number of prediction lookups in %s (including wrong-path)",name);
00603   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &lookups, lookups, NULL);
00604   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.updates",id,name);
00605   sprintf(buf2,"number of prediction updates in %s",name);
00606   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &updates, updates, NULL);
00607   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.spec_updates",id,name);
00608   sprintf(buf2,"number of speculative prediction updates in %s",name);
00609   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &spec_updates, spec_updates, NULL);
00610   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.hits",id,name);
00611   sprintf(buf2,"number of correct predictions in %s",name);
00612   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_hits, num_hits, NULL);
00613   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.hit_rate",id,name);
00614   sprintf(buf2,"fraction of correct predictions in %s",name);
00615   sprintf(buf3,"c%d.%s.hits/c%d.%s.updates",id,name,id,name);
00616   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00617   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.MPKI",id,name);
00618   sprintf(buf2,"misses per thousand insts in %s",name);
00619   sprintf(buf3,"((c%d.%s.updates - c%d.%s.hits) / c%d.commit_insn) * 1000.0",id,name,id,name,id);
00620   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00621 
00622   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.num_nt",id,name);
00623   sprintf(buf2,"number of NT predictions from %s",name);
00624   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_nt, num_nt, NULL);
00625   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.frac_nt",id,name);
00626   sprintf(buf2,"fraction of targets predicted NT by %s",name);
00627   sprintf(buf3,"c%d.%s.num_nt / c%d.%s.updates",id,name,id,name);
00628   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00629 }
00630 
00631 void BTB_t::reset_stats()
00632 {
00633   num_hits = 0;
00634   lookups = 0;
00635   updates = 0;
00636   spec_updates = 0;
00637   num_nt = 0;
00638 }
00639 
00640 class BTB_sc_t * BTB_t::get_cache(void)
00641 {
00642   class BTB_sc_t * sc = new BTB_sc_t();
00643   if(!sc)
00644     fatal("couldn't calloc default State Cache");
00645   return sc;
00646 }
00647 
00648 void BTB_t::ret_cache(class BTB_sc_t * sc)
00649 {
00650   delete(sc);
00651 }
00652 
00653 
00654 /*=================================================*/
00655 /* RAS (Return address stack predictor) functions  */
00656 /*=================================================*/
00657 
00658 
00659 
00660 /* RETURN ADDRESS PREDICTION
00661 Arguments:
00662 cpvp       - pointer to a checkpoint (for recovery)
00663 PC         - program counter (PC) value, *not* shifted
00664 ftPC       - fall-through PC (i.e., the return address)
00665 tPC        - taken-branch target address, *not* shifted
00666 oPC        - oracle PC or actual return address
00667  */
00668 #define RAS_PUSH_HEADER \
00669   void push(const md_addr_t PC,const md_addr_t ftPC,const md_addr_t tPC,const md_addr_t oPC)
00670 #define RAS_POP_HEADER \
00671   md_addr_t pop(const md_addr_t PC,const md_addr_t tPC,const md_addr_t oPC)
00672 #define RAS_RECOVER_HEADER \
00673   void recover(class RAS_chkpt_t * const cpvp)
00674 #define RAS_RECOVER_STATE_HEADER \
00675   void recover_state(class RAS_chkpt_t * const cpvp)
00676 #define RAS_REG_STATS_HEADER \
00677   void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb, struct core_t * const core)
00678 #define RAS_RESET_STATS_HEADER \
00679   void reset_stats(void)
00680 #define RAS_GET_STATE_HEADER \
00681   class RAS_chkpt_t * get_state(void)
00682 #define RAS_RET_STATE_HEADER \
00683   void ret_state(class RAS_chkpt_t * const cpvp)
00684 
00685 
00686 #include "ZCOMPS-ras.list"
00687 
00688 
00689 #define BPRED_PARSE_ARGS
00690 static class RAS_t *
00691 RAS_from_string(char * const opt_string)
00692 {
00693   char name[256];
00694   char type[256];
00695 
00696   /* the format string "%[^:]" for scanf reads a string consisting of non-':' characters */
00697   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%[^:]",type) != 1)
00698     fatal("malformed RAS option string: %s",opt_string);
00699 
00700   /* include the argument parsing code.  BPRED_PARSE_ARGS is defined to
00701      include only the parsing code and not the other predictor code. */
00702 #include "ZCOMPS-ras.list"
00703 
00704   /* UNKNOWN RAS Type */
00705   fatal("Unknown RAS type (%s)",opt_string);
00706 }
00707 #undef BPRED_PARSE_ARGS
00708 
00709 RAS_t::RAS_t()
00710 {
00711   init();
00712 }
00713 
00714 RAS_t::~RAS_t()
00715 {
00716   if(name) free(name); name = NULL;
00717   if(type) free(type); type = NULL;
00718 }
00719 
00720 void RAS_t::init(void)
00721 {
00722   name = NULL;
00723   type = NULL;
00724   bits = 0;
00725   num_hits = 0;
00726   num_pushes = 0;
00727   num_pops = 0;
00728   num_recovers = 0;
00729   frozen = false;
00730 }
00731 
00732 void
00733 RAS_t::push(
00734     const md_addr_t PC,
00735     const md_addr_t fallthruPC,
00736     const md_addr_t targetPC,
00737     const md_addr_t oraclePC)
00738 {
00739 }
00740 
00741 void RAS_t::recover(class RAS_chkpt_t * const cp)
00742 {
00743 }
00744 
00745 void RAS_t::recover_state(RAS_chkpt_t * const cp)
00746 {
00747 }
00748 
00749 void
00750 RAS_t::reg_stats(
00751     struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb,
00752     struct core_t * const core)
00753 {
00754   int id = 0;
00755   if(core)
00756     id = core->current_thread->id;
00757   char buf[256];
00758   char buf2[256];
00759   char buf3[256];
00760 
00761   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.type",id,name);
00762   sprintf(buf2,"RAS type of %s",name);
00763   stat_reg_string(sdb, buf, buf2, type, NULL);
00764   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.bits",id,name);
00765   sprintf(buf2,"total size of %s in bits",name);
00766   stat_reg_int(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &bits, bits, NULL);
00767   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.size",id,name);
00768   sprintf(buf2,"total size of %s in KB",name);
00769   sprintf(buf3,"c%d.%s.bits/8192.0",id,name);
00770   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00771   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.pushes",id,name);
00772   sprintf(buf2,"number of stack pushes to %s (including wrong-path)",name);
00773   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_pushes, num_pushes, NULL);
00774   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.pops",id,name);
00775   sprintf(buf2,"number of stack pops to %s (including wrong-path)",name);
00776   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_pops, num_pops, NULL);
00777   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.recover",id,name);
00778   sprintf(buf2,"number of stack recoveries/repairs to %s",name);
00779   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_recovers, num_recovers, NULL);
00780   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.hits",id,name);
00781   sprintf(buf2,"correct predictions in %s",name);
00782   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_hits, num_hits, NULL);
00783   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.hit_rate",id,name);
00784   sprintf(buf2,"fraction of correct predictions in %s",name);
00785   sprintf(buf3,"c%d.%s.hits/c%d.%s.pops",id,name,id,name);
00786   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00787   sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.MPKI",id,name);
00788   sprintf(buf2,"misses per thousand insts in %s",name);
00789   sprintf(buf3,"((c%d.%s.pops - c%d.%s.hits) / c%d.commit_insn) * 1000.0",id,name,id,name,id);
00790   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
00791 }

00796   num_pushes = 0;

00801 class RAS_chkpt_t * RAS_t::get_state(void)
00802 {

00809 
00810 
00811 
00812 /*====================================================*/
00813 /* Functions for the top-level branch predictor class
00814    which contains all of the sub-predictors (e.g.,
00815    direction, meta, BTB, etc.)                        */
00816 /*====================================================*/
00817 
00818 bpred_t::bpred_t(
00819     const int arg_num_pred         /* num direction preds */,
00820     char ** const bpred_opts       /* config strings for dir preds */,
00821     char  * const fusion_opt       /* config string for meta-pred */,
00822     char  * const dirjmp_BTB_opt   /* direct jmp target pred config */,
00823     char  * const indirjmp_BTB_opt /* indirect jmp target pred config */,
00824     char  * const RAS_opt          /* subroutine retn addr pred config */
00825    )
00826 {
00827   num_pred = arg_num_pred;
00828 
00829   /* component br direction preds */
00830   bpreds = (class bpred_dir_t**) calloc(arg_num_pred,sizeof(class bpred_dir_t*));
00831   if(!bpreds)
00832     fatal("failed to calloc bpred array");
00833   for(int i=0;i<arg_num_pred;i++)
00834     bpreds[i] = bpred_from_string(bpred_opts[i]);
00835 
00836   /* meta-predictor */
00837   fusion = fusion_from_string(num_pred,bpreds,fusion_opt);
00838 
00839   /* target predictors */
00840   dirjmp_BTB = BTB_from_string(dirjmp_BTB_opt);
00841 
00842   if(indirjmp_BTB_opt)
00843   {
00844     if(strcasecmp(indirjmp_BTB_opt,"none")) /* use a different BTB for computed targets? */
00845       indirjmp_BTB = BTB_from_string(indirjmp_BTB_opt);
00846     else
00847       indirjmp_BTB = NULL;
00848   }
00849   else
00850     indirjmp_BTB = NULL;
00851 
00852   ras = RAS_from_string(RAS_opt);
00853 
00854   num_lookups = 0;
00855   num_updates = 0;
00856   num_spec_updates = 0;
00857   num_cond = 0;
00858   num_call = 0;
00859   num_ret = 0;
00860   num_uncond = 0;
00861   num_dir_hits = 0;  /* for *all* branches, conditional or not */
00862   num_addr_hits = 0; /* ditto */
00863   frozen = false;
00864 
00865   init_state_cache_pool(32);
00866 }
00867 
00868 bpred_t::~bpred_t()
00869 {
00870   destroy_state_cache_pool();
00871 
00872   if(indirjmp_BTB)
00873   {
00874     delete indirjmp_BTB; indirjmp_BTB = NULL;
00875   }
00876   delete dirjmp_BTB; dirjmp_BTB = NULL;
00877 
00878   delete ras; ras = NULL;
00879 
00880   delete fusion;
00881 
00882   for(int i=0;i<(int)num_pred;i++)
00883   {
00884     delete bpreds[i]; bpreds[i] = NULL;
00885   }
00886   free(bpreds); bpreds = NULL;
00887 }
00888 
00889 /*==============================================================
00890   Returns the address of the next predicted instruction.  This
00891   includes the outputs from the branch direction predictor,
00892   BTB(s) and RAS.
00893  ==============================================================*/
00894 md_addr_t
00895 bpred_t::lookup(
00896     class bpred_state_cache_t * const sc,
00897     const unsigned int opflags,
00898     const md_addr_t PC,
00899     const md_addr_t fallthruPC,
00900     const md_addr_t targetPC,
00901     const md_addr_t oraclePC,
00902     const bool outcome
00903    )
00904 {
00905   md_addr_t predPC, indirPredPC;
00906   int cond_dir = true;
00907   bool dir = 1;
00908 
00909   BPRED_STAT(num_lookups++;)
00910 
00911   /* first, we need to perform lookups in more or less everything so
00912      that the structures can set up recovery state if needed later. */
00913 
00914   /* TODO: only lookup when needed */
00915   for(int i=0;i<(int)num_pred;i++)
00916      sc->preds[i] = bpreds[i]->lookup(sc->pcache[i],PC,targetPC,oraclePC,outcome);
00917   cond_dir = fusion->lookup(sc->fcache,sc->preds,PC,targetPC,oraclePC,outcome);
00918   indirPredPC = predPC = dirjmp_BTB->lookup(sc->dirjmp,PC,targetPC,oraclePC,outcome,dir);
00919   if(indirjmp_BTB)
00920     indirPredPC = indirjmp_BTB->lookup(sc->indirjmp,PC,targetPC,oraclePC,outcome,dir);
00921 
00922   if(MD_IS_RETURN(opflags)) /* return from subroutine */
00923   {
00924     /* use RAS */
00925     predPC = ras->pop(PC,targetPC,oraclePC);
00926     sc->our_pred = 1;
00927   }
00928   else
00929   {
00930     if(opflags&F_COND) /* conditional branches */
00931     {
00932       dir = cond_dir;
00933     }
00934     else if(MD_IS_CALL(opflags)) /* subroutine call */
00935     {
00936       dir = 1;
00937       /* speculatively push return address on to stack */
00938       ras->push(PC,fallthruPC,targetPC,oraclePC);
00939     }
00940     else /* unconditional jmp/branch */
00941     {
00942       dir = 1;
00943     }
00944 
00945     sc->our_pred = dir;
00946 
00947     /* Get the predicted branch target */
00948     if(dir && (opflags&F_INDIRJMP)) /* INDIRJMP (computed)*/
00949       predPC = indirPredPC;
00950   }
00951   if(!dir || (predPC == 1) || (predPC == 0))
00952     predPC = fallthruPC;
00953 
00954   ras->recover_state(sc->ras_checkpoint);
00955   sc->our_target = predPC;
00956   return predPC;
00957 }
00958 
00959 /*==================================================================*/
00960 /* Branch prediction update: this function is called at commit and
00961    does not update the branch history registers.                    */
00962 /*==================================================================*/
00963 void
00964 bpred_t::update(
00965     class bpred_state_cache_t * const sc,
00966     const unsigned int opflags,
00967     const md_addr_t PC,
00968     const md_addr_t targetPC,
00969     const md_addr_t oraclePC,
00970     const bool outcome
00971    )
00972 {
00973   /* update stats */
00974   BPRED_STAT(num_updates++;)
00975   BPRED_STAT(num_dir_hits += (sc->our_pred == outcome);)
00976   BPRED_STAT(num_addr_hits += (sc->our_target == oraclePC);)
00977 
00978   if(!MD_IS_RETURN(opflags)) /* RETN's already speculatively handled */
00979   {
00980     /* else: no updates for uncond jmps/brs */
00981     if(opflags&F_COND)
00982     {
00983       BPRED_STAT(num_cond++;)
00984       for(int i=0;i<(int)num_pred;i++)
00985         bpreds[i]->update(sc->pcache[i],PC,targetPC,oraclePC,outcome,sc->preds[i]);
00986 
00987       fusion->update(sc->fcache,sc->preds,PC,targetPC,oraclePC,outcome,sc->our_pred);
00988     }
00989     else if(MD_IS_CALL(opflags))
00990     {
00991       BPRED_STAT(ras->num_pushes++;)
00992       BPRED_STAT(num_call++;)
00993     }
00994     else
00995       BPRED_STAT(num_uncond++;)
00996 
00997     /* CALL's also speculatively modified the RAS */
00998 
00999     /* update BTBs */
01000     if(indirjmp_BTB && (opflags&F_INDIRJMP)) /* INDIRJMP, and there's an iBTB */
01001     {
01002       indirjmp_BTB->update(sc->indirjmp,PC,targetPC,oraclePC,sc->our_target,outcome,sc->our_pred);
01003     }
01004     else /* DIRJMP or REP */
01005     {
01006       dirjmp_BTB->update(sc->dirjmp,PC,targetPC,oraclePC,sc->our_target,outcome,sc->our_pred);
01007     }
01008   }
01009   else
01010   {
01011     BPRED_STAT(ras->num_pops++;)
01012     if(sc->our_target == oraclePC)
01013       BPRED_STAT(ras->num_hits++;)
01014     BPRED_STAT(num_ret++;)
01015   }
01016 }
01017 
01018 /* Speculative update of branch history registers (and any other state you may
01019    care to speculatively update).  This is called in the front-end. */
01020 void
01021 bpred_t::spec_update(
01022     class bpred_state_cache_t * const sc,
01023     const unsigned int opflags,
01024     const md_addr_t PC,
01025     const md_addr_t targetPC,
01026     const md_addr_t oraclePC,
01027     const bool outcome
01028    )
01029 {
01030   /* update stats */
01031   BPRED_STAT(num_spec_updates++;)
01032 
01033   /* only update conditional, all are updated with the "final" prediction, not their individual predictions */
01034   if(opflags&F_COND)
01035   {
01036     for(int i=0;i<(int)num_pred;i++)
01037       bpreds[i]->spec_update(sc->pcache[i],PC,targetPC,oraclePC,outcome,sc->our_pred);
01038 
01039     fusion->spec_update(sc->fcache,sc->preds,PC,targetPC,oraclePC,outcome,sc->our_pred);
01040 
01041     dirjmp_BTB->spec_update(sc->dirjmp,PC,targetPC,oraclePC,sc->our_target,outcome,sc->our_pred);
01042     if(indirjmp_BTB)
01043       indirjmp_BTB->spec_update(sc->indirjmp,PC,targetPC,oraclePC,sc->our_target,outcome,sc->our_pred);
01044   }
01045 }
01046 
01047 
01048 /*==================================================================*/
01049 /* Hopefully uncorrupt the return address stack after a branch
01050    misprediction.  Also repair branch history registers.            */
01051 /*==================================================================*/
01052 
01053 void
01054 bpred_t::recover(
01055     class bpred_state_cache_t * const sc,
01056     const bool outcome)
01057 {
01058   for(int i=0;i<(int)num_pred;i++)
01059     bpreds[i]->recover(sc->pcache[i],outcome);
01060 
01061   fusion->recover(sc->fcache,outcome);
01062 
01063   if(ras)
01064     ras->recover(sc->ras_checkpoint);
01065 
01066   dirjmp_BTB->recover(sc->dirjmp,outcome);
01067 
01068   if(indirjmp_BTB)
01069     indirjmp_BTB->recover(sc->indirjmp,outcome);
01070 }
01071 
01072 /* Same as recover, but this does not shift in the latest branch outcome
01073    into the branch history registers.  This is used when flushing due to
01074    non-branch reasons (e.g., pipe-flush from load order violations). */
01075 void
01076 bpred_t::flush(class bpred_state_cache_t * const sc)
01077 {
01078   for(int i=0;i<(int)num_pred;i++)
01079     bpreds[i]->flush(sc->pcache[i]);
01080 
01081   fusion->flush(sc->fcache);
01082 
01083   if(ras)
01084     ras->recover(sc->ras_checkpoint);
01085 
01086   dirjmp_BTB->flush(sc->dirjmp);
01087 
01088   if(indirjmp_BTB)
01089     indirjmp_BTB->flush(sc->indirjmp);
01090 }
01091 
01092 
01093 void
01094 bpred_t::reg_stats(
01095     struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb,
01096     struct core_t * const core)
01097 {
01098   int id = 0;
01099   if(core)
01100     id = core->current_thread->id;
01101 
01102   char buf[256];
01103   char buf2[256];
01104   char buf3[256];
01105 
01106   sprintf(buf,"c%d.bpred_lookups",id);
01107   sprintf(buf2,"total branch predictor lookups (including wrong-path)");
01108   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_lookups, num_lookups, NULL);
01109   sprintf(buf,"c%d.bpred_updates",id);
01110   sprintf(buf2,"total branch predictor updates");
01111   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_updates, num_lookups, NULL);
01112   sprintf(buf,"c%d.bpred_cond_br",id);
01113   sprintf(buf2,"total branch predictor cond_br (non-speculative)");
01114   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_cond, num_cond, NULL);
01115   sprintf(buf,"c%d.bpred_calls",id);
01116   sprintf(buf2,"total branch predictor calls (non-speculative)");
01117   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_call, num_call, NULL);
01118   sprintf(buf,"c%d.bpred_rets",id);
01119   sprintf(buf2,"total branch predictor rets (non-speculative)");
01120   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_ret, num_ret, NULL);
01121   sprintf(buf,"c%d.bpred_unconds",id);
01122   sprintf(buf2,"total branch predictor unconds (non-speculative)");
01123   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_uncond, num_uncond, NULL);
01124   sprintf(buf,"c%d.bpred_dir_hits",id);
01125   sprintf(buf2,"total branch predictor dir_hits (non-speculative)");
01126   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_dir_hits, num_dir_hits, NULL);
01127   sprintf(buf,"c%d.bpred_addr_hits",id);
01128   sprintf(buf2,"total branch predictor addr_hits (non-speculative)");
01129   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &num_addr_hits, num_addr_hits, NULL);
01130   sprintf(buf,"c%d.bpred_dir_rate",id);
01131   sprintf(buf2,"overall branch direction prediction rate");
01132   sprintf(buf3,"c%d.bpred_dir_hits/c%d.bpred_updates",id,id);
01133   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
01134   sprintf(buf,"c%d.bpred_addr_rate",id);
01135   sprintf(buf2,"overall branch address prediction rate");
01136   sprintf(buf3,"c%d.bpred_addr_hits/c%d.bpred_updates",id,id);
01137   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
01138   sprintf(buf,"c%d.bpred_dir_MPKI",id);
01139   sprintf(buf2,"overall branch direction mispredictions per Kinst");
01140   sprintf(buf3,"((c%d.bpred_updates-c%d.bpred_dir_hits)/c%d.commit_insn) * 1000.0",id,id,id);
01141   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
01142   sprintf(buf,"c%d.bpred_addr_MPKI",id);
01143   sprintf(buf2,"overall branch address mispredictions per Kinst");
01144   sprintf(buf3,"((c%d.bpred_updates-c%d.bpred_addr_hits)/c%d.commit_insn) * 1000.0",id,id,id);
01145   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, NULL);
01146 
01147   for(int i=0;i<(int)num_pred;i++)
01148     bpreds[i]->reg_stats(sdb,core);
01149 
01150   fusion->reg_stats(sdb,core);
01151 
01152   dirjmp_BTB->reg_stats(sdb,core);
01153   if(indirjmp_BTB)
01154     indirjmp_BTB->reg_stats(sdb,core);
01155 
01156   ras->reg_stats(sdb,core);
01157 }
01158 
01159 /* Reset branch predictor stats after fast-forwarding/warming */
01160 void bpred_t::reset_stats(void)
01161 {
01162   for(int i=0;i<(int)num_pred;i++)
01163     bpreds[i]->reset_stats();
01164   fusion->reset_stats();
01165   ras->reset_stats();
01166   dirjmp_BTB->reset_stats();
01167   if(indirjmp_BTB)
01168     indirjmp_BTB->reset_stats();
01169 
01170   num_lookups = 0;
01171   num_updates = 0;
01172   num_spec_updates = 0;
01173   num_cond = 0;
01174   num_call = 0;
01175   num_ret = 0;
01176   num_uncond = 0;
01177   num_dir_hits = 0;
01178   num_addr_hits = 0;
01179 }
01180 
01181 /* tell the branch predictor components that their stats should now be frozen */
01182 void bpred_t::freeze_stats(void)
01183 {
01184   frozen = true;
01185   for(int i=0;i<(int)num_pred;i++)
01186     bpreds[i]->frozen = true;
01187   fusion->frozen = true;
01188   ras->frozen = true;
01189   dirjmp_BTB->frozen = true;
01190   if(indirjmp_BTB)
01191     indirjmp_BTB->frozen = true;
01192 }
01193 
01194 
01195 
01196 /*====================================================================*/
01197 /* These functions return a suitably sized array for storing the
01198    outcomes, and cache predictor state.  This can then be passed back
01199    to the update function.  The "State Cache" is analogous to the
01200    bpred_update structs in the old bpred.[ch], but each predictor
01201    component may furnish their own struct, so any kind of data may
01202    be squirreled away without changing any code outside of the
01203    predictor implementation.  Since the structs aren't known ahead
01204    of time, a new State Cache must be allocated each time a br/jmp
01205    instruction is processed, and deallocated when the simulator is
01206    done with that inst.  To avoid constantly calloc/free-ing these
01207    State Caches, we maintain a pool of these State Caches, reusing
01208    the structs whenever we can. */
01209 /*====================================================================*/
01210 
01211 
01212 void
01213 bpred_t::init_state_cache_pool(const int start_size)
01214 {
01215   if(start_size <= 0)
01216     fatal("bpred State Cache must be initialized to 1 or more elements");
01217 
01218   bpredSCC_size = start_size;
01219   bpredSCC_head = 0;
01220 
01221   bpredSCC = (class bpred_state_cache_t**) calloc(start_size,sizeof(*bpredSCC));
01222   if(!bpredSCC)
01223     fatal("couldn't calloc bpred SCC");
01224 }
01225 
01226 /* Any state caches available in the free pool?  If so, return one
01227    and update the pool's pointers.  If not, allocate a new one and
01228    return that. */
01229 class bpred_state_cache_t *
01230 bpred_t::get_state_cache(void)
01231 {
01232   class bpred_state_cache_t * sc;
01233 
01234   if(!bpredSCC[bpredSCC_head])
01235   {
01236     SC_debt ++;
01237     sc = new bpred_state_cache_t();
01238     if(!sc)
01239       fatal("couldn't calloc prediction container");
01240     sc->preds = (bool*) calloc(num_pred,sizeof(*sc->preds));
01241     if(!sc->preds)
01242       fatal("couldn't calloc prediction container");
01243     sc->pcache = (class bpred_sc_t**) calloc(num_pred,sizeof(class bpred_sc_t**));
01244     if(!sc->pcache)
01245       fatal("couldn't calloc prediction container");
01246     for(int i=0;i<(int)num_pred;i++)
01247       sc->pcache[i] = bpreds[i]->get_cache();
01248     sc->fcache = fusion->get_cache();
01249     sc->dirjmp = dirjmp_BTB->get_cache();
01250     if(indirjmp_BTB)
01251       sc->indirjmp = indirjmp_BTB->get_cache();
01252     sc->ras_checkpoint = ras->get_state();
01253   }
01254   else
01255   {
01256     sc = bpredSCC[bpredSCC_head];
01257     bpredSCC[bpredSCC_head] = NULL;
01258     if(bpredSCC_head > 0)
01259       bpredSCC_head--;
01260   }
01261   return sc;
01262 }
01263 
01264 
01265 /* Simulator's finished using the State Cache, so return it
01266    to the pool.  If returning the State Cache to the pool
01267    would exceed the pool's capacity, realloc it at twice the
01268    size so the number of realloc is only the log2 of the
01269    peak number of State Caches simultaneously in use. */
01270 void
01271 bpred_t::return_state_cache(class bpred_state_cache_t * const sc)
01272 {
01273   if(bpredSCC[bpredSCC_head] == NULL)
01274   {
01275     bpredSCC[bpredSCC_head] = sc;
01276     return;
01277   }
01278 
01279   if(bpredSCC_head == (bpredSCC_size-1))
01280   {
01281     const int new_size = bpredSCC_size*2;
01282     bpredSCC = (class bpred_state_cache_t**) realloc(bpredSCC,new_size*sizeof(*bpredSCC));
01283     if(!bpredSCC)
01284       fatal("couldn't realloc bpredSCC");
01285     for(int i=bpredSCC_size;i<new_size;i++)
01286       bpredSCC[i] = NULL;
01287     bpredSCC_size = new_size;
01288   }
01289 
01290   bpredSCC_head ++;
01291   bpredSCC[bpredSCC_head] = sc;
01292 }
01293 
01294 /* At the very end of the simulation, we need to clean up.
01295    This frees any State Caches still in the pool, as well
01296    as the array for the pool itself. */
01297 void
01298 bpred_t::destroy_state_cache_pool(void)
01299 {
01300   struct bpred_state_cache_t * sc;
01301 
01302   for(int i=0;i<bpredSCC_size;i++)
01303   {
01304     sc = bpredSCC[i];
01305     if(sc)
01306     {
01307       ras->ret_state(sc->ras_checkpoint);
01308       if(indirjmp_BTB)
01309         indirjmp_BTB->ret_cache(sc->indirjmp);
01310       dirjmp_BTB->ret_cache(sc->dirjmp);
01311       fusion->ret_cache(sc->fcache);
01312       for(int j=0;j<(int)num_pred;j++)
01313         bpreds[j]->ret_cache(sc->pcache[j]);
01314       free(sc->pcache); sc->pcache = NULL;
01315       free(sc->preds); sc->preds = NULL;
01316       delete(sc);
01317       SC_debt --;
01318     }
01319     bpredSCC[i] = NULL;
01320   }
01321 
01322   /* Did we free the same number of State Caches as we
01323      allocated? */
01324   if(SC_debt)
01325     fprintf(stderr,"warning (bpred): Leaked state caches = %d\n",SC_debt);
01326 
01327   free(bpredSCC);
01328   bpredSCC = NULL;
01329   bpredSCC_size = 0;
01330   bpredSCC_head = 0;
01331 }
01332 
01333 #undef BPRED_STAT
